newsitem.title: UK: TI Group says results ahead of year-ago.
newsitem.headline: TI Group says results ahead of year-ago.

text.p: British engineering firm TI Group Plc said on Thursday its results and order books in the first four months of the year were ahead of last year.
The company also said it named Bob Fisher as vice chairman with immediate effect.

"While the John Crane Group is finding its industrial markets challenging, the Bundy Group is performing well and the Dowty Group is maintaining the encouraging trends seen during 1996," the company said in a statement from its annual meeting.
TI said it had a strong balance sheet with modest gearing and would continue to look for more "bolt-on" acquisitions to accelerate its growth.
TI's shares were off 0.5p at 563 by 1145 GMT.
